message: Amazon SES might be better - it's certainly cheaper - but I've heard that it has issues with HTML attachments
I'm currently using webfaction's SMTP server to send email. What do you guys use to send email on ep.io?
We, as a company, are using sendgrid at the moment, but only as we had a discount code already.

I am using amazon SES for great profit, and it has been ridonkulously cheap so far ($0.01) for 2 months of light (<1000) usage. Haven't encountered issues with HTML parts yet (using https://github.com/bradwhittington/django-templated-email and django-SES for now), but I haven't done anything complicated. Mailchimp STS def. uses/requires html parts and uses Amazon SES for sending...
thanks, I think I'll give amazon SES a try.
I also use Amazon SES together with bouncely.com to track my bounces. > 100k emails per month so far, very cheap.
I'm a huge fan of mailgun http://mailgun.net/
I am using mailgun for inbound email (smtp -> http ftw), and SES for outbound as it is a lot cheaper...
I'm currently using http://postmarkapp.com/ to get around this.
